text: Well, my name is Esperanza Huayama Aguirre,
from the village of Rodeo Pampa,
very far away from here.
Well I …
when a committee  from Lima arrived,
many friends and I …
they took several of us to the policlinic,
they gathered more than a hundred women there
that day when that committee came,
it was like being in a prison.
They closed the gate,
and when some women saw how others were crying with the pain
they wanted to leave,
but we were already inside and they wouldn't let us leave.
They took me inside
and drew blood from my finger for tests
and then they brought me to do the sterilisation
and gave me the anaesthetic.
I was just falling asleep
as they started cutting me
and it hurt …
I heard them saying
'she's is pregnant'
Then I,
because God didn't want my baby to die at that moment,
I said to them: 'I don't want you to remove my baby,
I'd rather die with my baby,
leave my baby there.'
They put the anesthesia again
and after that I don't remember anything.
I remember around 6 pm with a tremendous pain,
that they had made us lie down head to feet,
2 in a single bed.
And I woke up with tremendous pain,
the IV line had come out of my arm.
Me with tremendous pain,
and they threw us out and told us we all had to go home.
And a lady that had also been cut badly
was sent to Piura and she had died in Piura.
And we ended up …
I was 3 months pregnant when they did it,
and until I was 7 months
there was a doctor that checked on me,
his name was Guerrero.
That doctor,
very angrily said that those doctors had come
and didn't make us healthy
but had made a damage by cutting our bellies.
Some women had ended up really bad,
and he kept checking on me every 3 days,
every 3 days.
I spent a lot,
thank God my husband he got the money
so that I could be a bit better.
My belly had swollen and I used to sleep like sitting down
I suffered with my little child like this
until 7 months.
I wasn't at all well,
the belly was very swollen
and the doctor was checking on me,
and he told me it was better if I went to Piura
because here they wouldn't be able to
I went to say goodbye to my children,
I had 7 small children.
I said goodbye to them to go to Piura
They took me to my village, Rodeo Pampa
around 1 in the morning
I woke up with a tremendous pain and
I stood up
and huge gush of blood came out of me,
like a haemorrhage.
And then with a midwife,
because in the countryside there are midwifes
and they also fix our bellies,
until they brought me to Huancabamba.
And …
around 6, 7 in the morning,
I don't remember much,
but the midwife had already helped me give birth.
They had seen him and pulled him out with the doctor.
Well, my child he died,
and I was really unwell
and I'm still really unwell.
It gets swollen when I make effort,
my belly gets swollen,
my waist hurts.
I can't go to the country anymore
cause I can't strain myself.
I can still do soft things
but I can't be in the country,
it hurts me.
This is why us peasant women,
because we were illiterate
they did what they wanted to us.
But now we say that these things
that have damaged all the women in this area
must not happen again.
In Huarmaca everyone is bad, we are all bad.
The women feel awful.
And we have this experience
and we won't allow other young women
to go through it,
we won't allow this to happen again.
That is why
we are asking for women's rights.
Thank you.
